pr_title: [CAM-12091] fix(engine): add error when parsing process without start event

timeline.message:

fix(engine): add error when parsing process without start event

related to CAM-12091

timeline.author: mboskamp

timeline.bodyText:
Let's stick with the file pattern that is used for the other tests (i.e. TestClass.TestMethod.bpmn20.xml, your file has the ending .bpmn). Also, we do not need to include positioning information here. Let's use a basic example which is more human-friendly :)
The file can look like this:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<definitions id="taskAssigneeExample" 
             xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/MODEL"
             xmlns:camunda="http://camunda.org/schema/1.0/bpmn"
             targetNamespace="Examples">
  <process id="Process_1" isExecutable="true">
    <userTask id="userTask" />
    <endEvent id="endEvent" />
    <sequenceFlow id="flow_1" sourceRef="userTask" targetRef="endEvent" />
  </process>
</definitions>
timeline.author: mboskamp

replies.bodyText: I implemented your suggested changes, thanks! However, I see a lot of test files with the .bpmn extension as well. Additionally, the Camunda modeler also seems to create .bpmn files by default. Perhaps something to look at to prevent having to include this review comment in future PRs.
replies.author: daveychu

replies.bodyText: I agree that we do not have to be too strict on this and that we already have a mixture of files here. However, thanks for keeping it simple @daveychu and simply adjusting it. 😃
replies.author: tmetzke
